interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Midnight in Paris [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2012/01/25
Store: Owen Wilson  (Actor),     Rachel McAdams  (Actor),     Woody Allen  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Oscar Central, Past Oscar Winners
Product Description: ['Product Description', "This is a romantic comedy set in Paris about a family that goes there because of business, and two young people who are engaged to be married in the fall have experiences there that change their lives. It's about a young man's great love for a city, Paris, and the illusion people have that a life different from theirs would be much better.", 'Amazon.com', 'Paris is a city that lends itself to daydreaming, to walking the streets and imagining all sorts of magic, a quality that Woody Allen understands perfectly.', 'Midnight in Paris', "is Allen's charming reverie about just that quality, with a screenwriter hero named Gil (Owen Wilson) who strolls the lanes of Paris with his head in the clouds and walks right into his own best fantasy. Gil is there with his materialistic fiancée (Rachel McAdams) and her unpleasant parents, taking a break from his financially rewarding but spiritually unfulfilling Hollywood career--and he can't stop thinking that all he wants to do is quit the movies, move to Paris, and write that novel he's been meaning to finish. You know, be like his heroes in the bohemian Paris of the 1920s. Sure enough, a midnight encounter draws him into the jazzy world of Scott and Zelda Fitzgerald, Picasso and Dali, and an intense Ernest Hemingway, who promises to bring Gil's manuscript to Gertrude Stein for review. Gil wakes up every morning back in the real world, but returning to his enchanted Paris proves fairly easy. In the execution of this marvelous fantasia, Allen pursues the idea that people of every generation have always romanticized a previous age as golden (this is in fact explained to us by Michael Sheen's pedantic art expert), but he also honors Gil's need to find out certain truths for himself. The movie's on the side of gentle fantasy, and it has some literary/cinematic in-jokes that call back to the kind of goofy humor Allen created in", 'Love and Death', ".The film is guilty of the slackness that Allen's latter-day directing has sometimes shown, and the underwritten roles for McAdams and Marion Cotillard are better acted than written. But the city glows with Allen's romantic sense of it, and Owen Wilson has just the right nice-guy melancholy to put the idea over. A worthy entry in the Cinema of the Daydream.", '--Robert Horton']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance, Comedy', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michel Vuillermoz, Olivier Rabourdin, Owen Wilson, Thierry Hancisse, Adrien de Van, Michael Sheen, Marianne Basler, Woody Allen, Marion Cotillard, Marcial Di Fonzo Bo, Laurent Spielvogel, Rachel McAdams, Gad Elmaleh, Adrien Brody, Catherine Benguigui, Léa Seydoux, Carla Bruni, Kathy BatesMichel Vuillermoz, Olivier Rabourdin, Owen Wilson, Thierry Hancisse, Adrien de Van, Michael Sheen, Marianne Basler, Woody Allen, Marion Cotillard, Marcial Di Fonzo Bo, Laurent Spielvogel, Rachel McAdams, Gad Elmaleh, Adrien Brody, Catherine Benguigui, Léa Seydoux…  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '23915943', 'Director': 'Woody Allen', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 20, 2011', 'Actors': 'Owen Wilson, Rachel McAdams, Adrien Brody, Carla Bruni, Marion Cotillard', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The film is very entertaining, and worth watching just for the atmospheric views of Paris.  I never would have expected to find Owen Wilson in a Woody Allen film, but he is very good in this one.  Blu-Ray is nicely done.  All in all, an excellent presentation of an excellent film.
Review Title: Excellent
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

{'Genre': 'Romance, Comedy', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michel Vuillermoz, Olivier Rabourdin, Owen Wilson, Thierry Hancisse, Adrien de Van, Michael Sheen, Marianne Basler, Woody Allen, Marion Cotillard, Marcial Di Fonzo Bo, Laurent Spielvogel, Rachel McAdams, Gad Elmaleh, Adrien Brody, Catherine Benguigui, Léa Seydoux, Carla Bruni, Kathy BatesMichel Vuillermoz, Olivier Rabourdin, Owen Wilson, Thierry Hancisse, Adrien de Van, Michael Sheen, Marianne Basler, Woody Allen, Marion Cotillard, Marcial Di Fonzo Bo, Laurent Spielvogel, Rachel McAdams, Gad Elmaleh, Adrien Brody, Catherine Benguigui, Léa Seydoux…  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.5 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '23915943', 'Director': 'Woody Allen', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 20, 2011', 'Actors': 'Owen Wilson, Rachel McAdams, Adrien Brody, Carla Bruni, Marion Cotillard', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
The film is very entertaining, and worth watching just for the atmospheric views of Paris.  I never would have expected to find Owen Wilson in a Woody Allen film, but he is very good in this one.  Blu-Ray is nicely done.  All in all, an excellent presentation of an excellent film.
Excellent
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Film Preference**: Enjoys romantic comedies that explore themes of nostalgia and fantasy, particularly set in iconic locations like Paris.
- **Director Affinity**: Shows appreciation for the work of Woody Allen, indicating a preference for films with a unique narrative style and character-driven storytelling.
- **Actor Favoritism**: Likes Owen Wilson, recognizing his strong performances in nuanced, romantic roles.
- **Viewing Format**: Prefers Blu-ray for enhanced visual and sound quality, suggesting a focus on the cinematic experience.
- **Content Appreciation**: Values atmospheric cinematography and engaging storytelling, particularly when tied to cultural or historical elements.
- **Rating Behavior**: Leans towards high ratings (average rating of 4.7), indicating a tendency to favor quality films.
- **Review Tone**: Expresses enjoyment and finds films entertaining based on their artistic presentation and atmospheric qualities, hinting at a deeper appreciation for film as an art form.

Overall, the user demonstrates a strong inclination towards charming cinematic experiences underscored by emotional narratives, particularly those that feature a romantic ambiance and notable performances.
